intro: Cordula hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy cordula, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or streambanks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, which is a common floral arrangement in the carrot family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cordula hirsutissima is considered a botanical curiosity and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
